title: Thunderbird 138.0.2 (and earlier) not showing some Outlook IMAP folders on Windows 10
content:
Several months ago, I have noticed that several folders were missing in Thunderbird. These folders exist on Outlook as viewed with a browser. I could not force the addition of those folders. Sometimes, I could rename a folder and it would show content for some days before disappearing.

I am also having problems that a folder exists with not individual email account, but two subfolders have their full content. I cannot use Thunderbird to add content to a folder with empty content, except for the working subfolders. I have tried "Repair Folder" with no success. If "Foothill.msf" exists, it has zero or little content. I can generate new folders. I've been running Thunderbird for decades without a problem this severe.

        • Outlook via browser is now missing the Foothill folder, but one of the subfolders exists on Thunderbird.!
creator: rstehle

title: Posta in ingresso scomparsa su Thunderbird
content:
Buongiorno, ho notato che molti messaggi, un tempo presenti in posta in arrivo, legati ad un solo account di posta sono improvvisamente scomparti. Premetto di avere le stesse configurazioni su tutti gli account in uso, identiche a quelle impostate su tutti gli altri device, e di non aver apportato alcun tipo di modifica.

Pur disinstallando e reinstallando Thunderbird il problema non si è risolto. Per Aruba, ove l'account di posta è attivo, non ci sono anomalie.

Quale potrebbe essere il problema?

Grazie in anticipo per il supporto.
creator: trader.holland.nl

title: Address book sync with Radicale
content:
I synchronize my Thunderbird Address Books (Windows PC) via the Radicale server with an Android phone with DAVx5. From Thunderbird to Android, sync works correct. New items and changes show up on Android. But from Android to Thunderbird, nothing syncs. From Android to the Radicale server, all seems well, because the changes show up in the Radicale collection, as show when you download the .vcs file.

So the problem seems between Radicale and Thunderbird. Can someone please help to debug this problem? E.g. is there a log of Thunderbird for the sync of the addressbook?

Thanks!
creator: mp+firefox

title: high core temperature increase when using TB monthly version
content:
Hello For more than 15 days, I have had a temperature >90°c for a long period. I've reinstalled my system but I'm still experiencing the same problem. I have a simple use from internet applications: firefox, thunderbird, agenda, joplin in their latest versions. I installed the latest version of the bios but it didn't improve the situation much. I've installed the latest standalone versions of Firefox, including thunderbird 138.0.2 (64 bits).

At each launch, I have a sudden increase in cpu (which resets after 20 to 30s) and the temperature doesn't drop much below 90°C. I've noticed the same thing with Firefox, but I'm posting here because if I'm not active on the PC, I still connect to my numerous mailboxes periodically. If I close my applications and do nothing, it goes down again after about 30 minutes. As this is a new configuration on the latest Ubuntu 25.04 version, I wonder if there could be a problem with TB or Firefox?

My processor : Intel Core i3-1115G4 (Dual-Core 1.7 GHz - 3 GHz / 4.1 GHz Turbo - 4 Threads - Cache 6 Mo) - RAM = 32go

Regards
creator: HdInfAutre

title: TB Mail Settings
content:
Hi all, New (ish) user to TB here so please be gentle ha ha!

I was using a 2013 Mac on Catalina and recently moved onto a 2019 Mac running Sequoia.

Everything copied over from old system onto new, however when I opend TB on the new Mac, my font is tiny and when I open a new email that is tiny too. The only way to enlarge it is to hold the CMD key and press + 6 times to get it to the size I want it.

I have been through all the articles etc to try to get it to stay enlarged, but as soon as I log off and back in, it goes back to being tiny.

Any help or guidance would be greatly appreciated!

title: i can't send any emails from gmail accounts
content: A week ago Thunderbird stopped sending messages from gmail accounts. I have a few accounts on my Thunderbird, and all of them are running smoothly regarding downloading messages, so I can read all of them, but I can send new messages only from non-gmail accounts. To use gmail I have to log to the web service. I tried to remove and add again gmail account, but it didn't help. I have the newest and actual version of Thunderbird. I didn't install any new apps last week. The message is: Sending the message failed. The message sending failed because the connection to the outgoing mail server (SMTP) timed out. Please try again or contact your network administrator. Hope someone can help me :) Best, Iwona

title: current thunderbird format/user interface is a nightmare
content:
Trying to solve a problem with thunderbird account email recipients not receiving emails with particular linked URLs embedded in the email I decided to see if maybe I could update thunderbird and that might solve the problem (see previous post/question https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1513733 )

The new user interface/format is completely different than the one I was used to and it took a good half hour to get it to behave at least a little like the old U.I.

It used to be easy to sort incoming mail by sender or date by clicking on the subject bar above the name or date and it would be rearranged to clearly show the order I was looking for, with a nice broad layout in the right hand pane. Now I have to go to view sort by and choose how I want it to be arranged, no way to close an open email in the right hand pane and show the received/sent emails in a nice broad easily readable pane on the right.

Starting to ramble, can't remember EXACTLY how the previous version worked/looked..... mea culpa.

Is there a way to go back to most recent previous version of Thunderbird with the old U>I>?

Thanks, Mike
creator: jgerstne

title: Search Results Font Size
content: How can I independently adjust the font size of the mail search results tab? A font size of 12 or 14 with a relaxed spacing is perfect for me in the main mail tab. However, when I search my inbox, the results list is something approximating 4 pitch font. I'd like to be able to independently adjust the font size on this tab without affecting the main inbox tab(s).

title: TB 128.10.2esr (64-bit) hangs editing a web link
content:
I believe this started with this upgrade to the client. I routinely was able to select a piece of text in an email and click the Insert Link... button, fill in the data, and click OK to embed a link.

Now I select a piece of text, press the Insert Link button, and Thunderbird hangs, requiring Task Manager to kill the program.

Embedded links already in i.e. templates work fine, but cannot be edited or upgraded.

Anybody else seeing this, or am I (typically) just being stupid about something?

Thanks John
creator: jagriswold

title: Thunderbird moves or can't find folders, disables filters on its own
content:
(1) Over the past year (maybe more?) folders move in Thunderbird seemingly by themselves. Which folders move is random. Then message filters don't work properly so the filter is unchecked until I move the folder back where it should be and reenable the filter. (2) Occasionally folders disappear completely, so I have to recreate and repopulate them. (3) Sometimes filters are disabled with no apparent cause. (4) More recently, Thunderbird filters can't find folders (though they appear to be in the correct place) so the filters also get disabled. Reenabling the filter doesn't help, and I have not found a workaround for this. Seems to be more and more frequent. (5) Yesterday whole folders were empty of messages that had been there the day before. One folder (on a W11) hasn't any messages for the last month, though on MacBooks the filter that feeds it is working OK.

I am not doing anything to cause this. I suspect it is a setting that either Mozilla or Comcast or Microsoft has changed. What can I do to stop this without having to switch to a different email system entirely?
creator: mfolly

title: Changing the subject of an incoming message
content: I would like to be able to change the subject of an incoming message so that I can find it a month later. Too often an online purchase gets confirmed with a message with a subject of "Your transaction" or something equally useless. It would be great if I could change it to "Order for washing machine hose" or "Hotel reservation in Atlanta". (It would be even better if the sender put a better description on the message). I currently forward the message to myself with a better subject line but that messes up the date it was received.

creator: Tequila

title: TB InBox Gets Corrupted; Repair Eliminates Recent Messages
content:
5/26/2025: I'm a long time TBird user, currently running 138.0.2-1 on Arch Linux 6.14.6-arch1-1 and xfce 4.20.4-1.

On 5/21/2025 my InBox began behaving strangely. After moving a message from InBox to another folder, TB announced that it was unable to compact InBox because it was read-only (which was obviously false). Various combinations of compacting InBox, stopping/starting TB, and rebooting the machine, seemed to work.

On 5/23/2025 things escalated. TB would not show the body of any messages in the Preview window, usually after I moved or deleted a message. Opening a message would open the appropriate window, but not show the body content; Reply showed neither body nor To:. Restarting and compacting InBox did no good. Other folders seemed to behave normally.

Taking the next step, I opened Properties for InBox and clicked Repair. The result was the disappearance of all my InBox messages back through 5/19/2025. Very irritating to lose several dozen messages.

On into today (5/26/2025) TB has been pretty well behaved (though I did update from 138.0.1-1 on 5/25/2025 as a hopeful pre-emptive strike). Then I moved a message from InBox and the Preview window failed to reflect the body of the now-current message or any other InBox message. Again, other folders were fine. No improvement with Compact, so I tried Repair again. This time it deleted InBox messages back through 5/6/2025.

I can restore from today's early a.m. backups, but have no idea how to reconcile with the current state of InBox. Obviously something is seriously wrong and I have no idea what to do. Meanwhile, I will deal with email clumsily on my phone.

PLEASE HELP!! Thanks.
creator: caj-bugz

title: Local CA being ignored
content:
I have added my local CA to the Certificate Manager (CA.png). When I try to send, I get the "confirm security exception" message (CertError.png). Viewing the certificate gives the data in Server.png and CACert.png.

The server cert is properly signed: $ openssl verify -CAfile ca-chain.cert.pem Mercury2.i-pi.com587.cert.pem Mercury2.i-pi.com587.cert.pem: OK

title: Please, remove my account from your "Spam Folder".
content:
My email Provider, TDS, says that I am in Thunderbird's Spam Folder, not theirs. I really need to send "Thank You" emails to over 40 companies for their donations of Door Prizes for the 48th Eastern VHF Conference on May 10, 2025. Today I tried to forward Scam emails to the Henniker Police Chief, and to Phishing. Some of them went through, but two did not. It said they were refused by you because of spam content. I get at least 6 scam emails a day, and try to forward them to the Police. Please, remove my account from your Spam Folder.

When I sent emails requesting Door Prizes, I had to include my own email address to get some of them to go out, but most would not go because you said they contained spam.

Please, put your Super Duper Technicians on this. When a lot of my emails will not go through, I find them in my "Drafts Folder". - They will not go through from there, either. Thunderbird says they have spam content and will not send them. My emails are not spam.

Thank you for helping me. 

 Michele Clement  603-428-3840
